title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act titled "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" provides expanded tax benefits for adoption that are made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" made expansions enacted in 2001 permanent and reinstated expansions enacted in 2010, including an increase in the dollar limitation for adoption credit. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increased the dollar limitations for adoption credit, with adjustments for inflation to be made for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2010. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increased the dollar limitations for adoption credit, with adjustments for inflation to be made for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2010. The income limitation for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002, involves rounding amounts to the nearest multiple of $10. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" raised the dollar limitations for adoption credit, with adjustments for inflation. The amendment increases the exclusion amount for adoption of a child with special needs from $10,000 to $13,170. The Code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010. Dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be increased based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. Amounts not multiples of $10 will be rounded. Starting from December 31, 2002, dollar amounts in subsection (b)(2)(A) will increase based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to make the credit refundable and moved to a different subpart. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to move section 36C to a new location before section 37. Conforming amendments are made to various sections by removing references to section 23. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by removing references to section 23 in various sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by removing references to section 23 in various sections, such as section 904(i), section 1016(a)(26), section 1400C(d), section 6211(b)(4)(A), and the table of sections for subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting new items after section 36B, such as 36C, in section 1324(b) of title 31, United States Code. Section 36C addresses adoption expenses, with amendments applying to taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
